section.p: The Development Regulations of Gwinnett County adopted January 5, 1988, and reprinted June, 1991, together with all amendments are incorporated by reference as part of this Code. An official copy of such ordinance and amendments is on file in the office of the clerk of the board of commissioners.

p.span: The planning division shall prepare and update as necessary future plans for the unincorporated portions of the county regarding land use types and locations, transportation facilities and other county resources and facilities, and shall review all proposed amendments to the county zoning resolution and prepare recommendations thereon for the board of commissioners.

The development division, unless otherwise specifically provided in this Code, shall enforce the following provisions of this Code, including inspection and permit issuance under the subdivision and zoning regulations and each building, plumbing or other technical code adopted in this chapter:

The director of the development division or a designee thereof shall be the enforcement official for each technical code adopted in this chapter, and the qualifications and organization of inspectors or other enforcement personnel shall be established under rules and regulations of the department or county notwithstanding the requirements of any technical code adopted in this chapter.

header.p: Departmental Duties of Planning and Development Divisions.

p.span: The planning division and its director of the division shall perform the following duties:
Maintain correct land use maps and files of all zoning amendments.
Prepare and recommend land use, transportation and other resource and facility plans to the board of commissioners.

Prepare recommendations on all zoning amendments for consideration by the board of commissioners, and generally provide for the application, noticing and hearing requirements of the amendment process.

Prepare and maintain data, maps or other information regarding population, employment and economic characteristics of the county and land development activities, including subdivisions and building permits.
Conduct the review and certification process required by the state metropolitan river protection act, as amended.
The director of the planning division shall serve as secretary to the planning and zoning commission, shall take and prepare its minutes and shall forward the minutes to the board of commissioners.
The development division and its director shall perform the following duties:

Provide for the orderly and safe development of the county through the provisions of the county subdivision regulations and other application regulations or standards as may be adopted by the board of commissioners.

Prepare recommendations on all requests for variances from the provisions of the county zoning resolution, and generally provide for the application, noticing and hearing requirements of the zoning variances process.
Enforce the development regulations and standards of the zoning resolution.
Enforce the county sediment control ordinance. This is a joint function with the engineering department.
Enforce the county building, electrical, plumbing, and heating and air conditioning codes.
Enforce development compliance with the state metropolitan river protection act, as amended.
The director of development shall serve as secretary to the board of zoning appeals, shall take and prepare its minutes, and shall forward the minutes to the board of commissioners.

It is the policy of the board of commissioners that an applicant for an amendment to the zoning map may withdraw such application without prejudice only until such time as the legal advertisement of a public hearing thereon is placed.

No application shall be allowed to be withdrawn under any circumstances after public notice of the public hearings has been placed. All applications having been advertised shall be considered by the board of commissioners and shall receive final action.

p.span: Participating jurisdictions. Any municipality in the county that wishes to participate in the municipal-county planning commission may do so by enacting an appropriate ordinance. Thereafter, a member appointed by the municipality may participate in all discussion before the commission, and may vote on any issue which affects property within the city limits.

The municipal-county planning commission shall consist of nine members who are residents of the county and residents of the district from which they are appointed and who shall be appointed by the county commissioners as outlined in this subsection, and one member who is a resident of each of the participating municipalities and who shall be appointed by the governing authority of the municipality as outlined in this subsection.

Each incumbent district commissioner shall appoint two members who shall reside in their respective districts, and the commission chairman shall appoint one member who resides in any district of the county to the planning commission. These members of the planning commission shall serve at the pleasure of the county board of commissioners. Any action to remove a member of the planning commission shall only be initiated by the appointing county commissioner.

The planning commission shall elect its chairman and vice-chairman from among its members. The chairman and vice-chairman shall serve for one year or until reelected or until a successor is elected. The planning commission shall appoint a secretary, who may be an officer or employee of the county or of one of the participating municipalities.

The planning commission shall adopt its own rules of procedure. It shall meet at least once each month at the call of the chairman and at such other times as the chairman or the members shall determine. All meetings of the planning commission at which official action is taken shall be open to the public. The planning commission shall keep a record of its resolutions, transactions, findings and determinations; and all of its records shall be public records.

The planning commission may appoint such employees and staff as it may deem necessary for its work and may contract with or accept funds from federal, state or local public or semipublic agencies or private individuals or corporations. It may contract with city planners and other consultants for such services as it may require. Its expenditures, exclusive of gifts, shall be within the amounts appropriated for the purpose by the governing authorities of the county and participating municipalities.

section.p: There is hereby created a county development advisory committee to serve at the pleasure of the board of commissioners and for such duration as the board may desire.
The purposes of the development advisory committee shall be to:

Assist the department in the interpretation and implementation of land development regulations.
Review proposed new land development regulations and amendments and advise the department and the board of commissioners on their impact and effectiveness.
Carry out such studies or investigations regarding the land development regulatory process or requirements as the board of commissioners may request from time to time.
Membership. The development advisory committee shall consist of 20 members, with at least one member each representing or having the following qualifications:

p.span: Nominations. For appointments to the development advisory committee, the board of commissioners shall seek and consider nominations from the following organizations at a minimum, if in existence:
County developer's association.
Council for quality growth.
Apartment owners and managers association.
Gwinnett Chapter, Home Builders Association of Metropolitan Atlanta.
Planning commission.
Zoning board of appeals.
County utilities coordinating committee.
County comprehensive plan coordinating committee.
Replacements. A member appointed to fill a vacancy which occurs during a year shall be appointed to fill the unexpired term of the vacant position for the remainder of the calendar year.

Compensation. The members of the development advisory committee shall serve without compensation or reimbursement of any kind. Normal costs of operations, such as meeting space, minutes, etc., shall be borne by the county through the department.
Limitation. No employee of the county government may be a member of the development advisory committee.

section.p: The members of the development advisory committee shall elect from among their number a chairman, vice-chairman, and such other officers as the committee may desire, for terms determined by the committee.

p.span: The development advisory committee shall meet at the call of its chairman, at such times as the committee may deem appropriate, or upon the call of the board of commissioners or the director of the department. Under no circumstances shall the committee meetings be called less often than once every two calendar months.
The development advisory committee may choose to adopt such bylaws for the conduct of its meetings as it deems necessary or appropriate.
Basic administrative support for the committee shall be coordinated or provided by the staff of the department.

The director of the department shall provide for the keeping of a record of the development advisory committee's actions and recommendations. The director shall be responsible for the transmittal of the record and of all communications and recommendations directed from the committee to the board of commissioners, in their normal course of business.

Meetings of the development advisory committee shall be open to all parties. While the committee may invite any person to participate or involve any person in its discussions and deliberations, all matters requiring formal decisions shall be decided only by a vote of the appointed members.
